page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: The roads in this area are without exception{minor roads},which are randomly distributed throughout the area. The roads are narrow with {passing places}interspersed along the route, to enable overtaking of large {farm machinery}as well as to allow passing of vehicles approaching from the opposite direction. Some of the roads follow{field boundaries,}which help farmers in the area in that they can easily check fields and crops. These roads also make the movement of heavy farm-machinery from field to field viable.{Access roads,}however, usually take the form of rough, dirt tracks which haven't been surfaced due to cost and this results in rapid deterioration especially during wet periods when heavy farm machinery breaks up the loose surface.
